ag_nodesag.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*****************************************************************************
00002 
00003   Description: This file contains C routines for navigating among the group
00004                nodes in an ODL tree. These routines augment the general
00005                purpose routines for manipulating aggregate nodes by
00006                providing mechanisms to locate group nodes, while
00007                ignoring object nodes. 
00008 
00009   Author:  Randy Davis, University of Colorado LASP
00010  
00011   Creation Date:  13 March 1991
00012   last Modified:  18 May 1991
00013 
00014   History:
00015 
00016     Creation - This set of routines was introduced in the Version 2.1
00017     release of the ODLC library.
00018 
00019   Version 2.2 - 18 May 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00020     Removed include statements that were Unix specific and placed them
00021     in odldef.h.
00022 
00023 *****************************************************************************/
00024 
00025 #include  "odldef.h"
00026 #include  "odlinter.h"
00027 
00028 
00029 
00030 /*****************************************************************************
00031 
00032   Routine: ParentGroup
00033  
00034   Description: Returns a pointer to the group containing an aggregate node.
00035  
00036   Input:
00037           base_node - A pointer to an aggregate node.
00038  
00039   Output: If the input aggregate node is within a group, a pointer to that
00040           group node is returned as the function value.  If the input node
00041           is not within a group, the NULL value is returned.  The NULL
00042           value is also returned if the input argument is NULL.
00043 
00044 *****************************************************************************/
00045  
00046 
00047 GROUP ParentGroup (AGGREGATE base_node)
00048 
00049 {
00050   AGGREGATE  node;               /* Pointer to current aggregate node       */
00051 
00052 
00053   node = base_node;
00054 
00055   do
00056     {
00057       node = ParentAggregate (node);
00058     } while (node != NULL && node->kind != KA_GROUP);
00059 
00060   return (node);
00061 }
00062 
00063 
00064 
00065 
00066 /*****************************************************************************
00067 
00068   Routine: NextGroup
00069  
00070   Description: Returns the next group node after the input aggregate node,
00071                according to a pre-order traversal of the ODL tree.
00072  
00073   Input:
00074           base_node  - A pointer to the starting aggregate node.
00075  
00076   Output: A pointer to the next group node is returned as the function value.
00077           The NULL value is returned if there is no next group node.  The
00078           NULL value is also returned if the input argument is NULL.
00079 
00080 *****************************************************************************/
00081  
00082 
00083 GROUP NextGroup (AGGREGATE base_node)
00084 
00085 {
00086   AGGREGATE  node;                    /* Pointer to the next node           */
00087 
00088 
00089   node = base_node;
00090 
00091   do
00092     {
00093       node = NextAggregate (node);
00094     } while (node != NULL && node->kind != KA_GROUP);
00095 
00096   return node;
00097 }
00098 
00099 
00100 
00101 /*****************************************************************************
00102 
00103   Routine: NextSubGroup
00104 
00105   Description: Returns the next group of the base node after the one
00106                pointed to by the start node.
00107 
00108   Input:
00109           base_node  - A pointer to the base aggregate node.
00110           start_node - A pointer to the starting node.
00111 
00112   Output: A pointer to the next group sub-node of the base node is
00113           returned as the function value.  A NULL value indicates that
00114           there is no next group sub-node.  The NULL value is also
00115           returned if the input argument is NULL.
00116 
00117 *****************************************************************************/
00118 
00119 
00120 GROUP NextSubGroup (AGGREGATE base_node, AGGREGATE start_node)
00121 
00122 {
00123   AGGREGATE  node;                    /* Pointer to the next node           */
00124 
00125 
00126   node = start_node;
00127 
00128   do
00129     {
00130       node = NextSubAggregate (base_node, node);
00131     } while (node != NULL && node->kind != KA_GROUP);
00132 
00133   return node;
00134 }
00135 
00136 
00137 
00138 
00139 /*****************************************************************************
00140 
00141   Routine: FindGroup
00142  
00143   Description: Finds a group node with a specified name.  The search starts
00144                with the base node and continues as necessary with all
00145                of the base nodes's children, all their children, and
00146                so on using a preorder search.
00147  
00148   Input:
00149           base_node - A pointer to the starting aggregate node.
00150           name      - Pointer to a character string with the name of the
00151                       group to be located. 
00152  
00153   Output: A pointer to the first group node that has the specified name.
00154           If no match is found, then the NULL value is returned.  The
00155           NULL value is also returned if either of the input arguments
00156           is NULL.
00157 
00158 *****************************************************************************/
00159  
00160 
00161 GROUP FindGroup (AGGREGATE base_node, char *name)
00162 
00163 {
00164   AGGREGATE  node;                    /* Pointer to current node           */
00165 
00166 
00167   if (base_node == NULL || name == NULL)
00168     {
00169       return (NULL);
00170     }
00171 
00172   /* Start searching with the base node and stop searching when we
00173      find a group node with the specified name or when we have
00174      visited all of the progeny of the base node  */
00175 
00176   node = base_node;
00177 
00178   while (node != NULL)
00179     {
00180       if (node->kind == KA_GROUP && strcmp (node->name, name) == 0)
00181         {
00182           break;
00183         }
00184 
00185       node = NextSubGroup (base_node, node);
00186     }
00187 
00188   return (node);
00189 }
00190 
00191 
00192 
00193 
00194 /*****************************************************************************
00195 
00196   Routine: FindNextGroup
00197  
00198   Description: This routine is similar to routine FindGroup in that it
00199                searches the progeny of the specified base node, except
00200                that the search begins with the node specified by the second
00201                argument. This is useful when there is more than one group
00202                node with the same name in the search path.
00203 
00204   Input:
00205           base_node  - A pointer to the base aggregate node for the search.
00206           start_node - A pointer to the starting node for the search.  The
00207                        search does not include the start node.
00208           name       - Pointer to a character string with the name of the
00209                        group to be located. 
00210  
00211   Output: A pointer to the next group node that has the specified name is
00212           returned as the function value. If no match is found, then the
00213           NULL value is returned. The NULL value is also returned if any
00214           of the three input arguments are NULL.
00215 
00216 *****************************************************************************/
00217  
00218 
00219 GROUP FindNextGroup (AGGREGATE base_node, AGGREGATE start_node, char *name)
00220 {
00221   AGGREGATE  node;                    /* Pointer to current node           */
00222 
00223 
00224   if (base_node == NULL || start_node == NULL || name == NULL)
00225     {
00226       return (NULL);
00227     }
00228 
00229   /* Start searching from the start node and stop searching when we find
00230      a group node with the specified name or when we have visited all of
00231      the progeny of the base node  */
00232 
00233   node = NextSubGroup (base_node, start_node);
00234 
00235   while (node != NULL && strcmp (node->name, name) != 0)
00236     { 
00237       node = NextSubGroup (base_node, node);
00238     } 
00239 
00240   return (node);
00241 }
